resources.string: Mercury is the smallest and closest planet to the sun in the Solar System.
Venus is the second planet from the Sun. It is named after the Roman goddess of love and beauty.
Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only astronomical object known to harbor life.
Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and the second-smallest planet in the Solar System, being larger than only Mercury.
Jupiter is the fifth planet from the Sun and the largest in the Solar System.
Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and the second-largest in the Solar System, after Jupiter.
Neptune is the eighth and farthest-known Solar planet from the Sun.
Pluto (minor planet designation: 134340 Pluto) is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper belt, a ring of bodies beyond the orbit of Neptune.
